meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Hungary.
meanings.sent1: In Hungary, you can buy many things with just one forint.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for forints before traveling to Hungary.
meanings.sent3: The forint in my pocket felt like a tiny treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a million forints.
meanings.sent5: The shiny forint sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A coin or banknote of Hungary, equal to one hundredth of a forint.
meanings.sent1: I found a forint coin on the street and picked it up.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a few forint banknotes for the bus fare.
meanings.sent3: The forint coin rolled away, playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His words were like scattered forint notes, hard to piece together.
meanings.sent5: The forint banknote crumpled in my hand as I paid for the snack.

meanings.definition: In exchange for; in order to obtain or achieve.
meanings.sent1: I will work hard forint to reach my goals.
meanings.sent2: She traded her necklace forint a rare painting.
meanings.sent3: He promised to clean the house forint a piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: Time is a currency we spend forint our desires.
meanings.sent5: I would travel the world forint a chance to see the Northern Lights.
